resource.string: Charm is a gift from the gods.
"""You will all die in bondage unless you kill your masters first!"""
"""One day, all people will be free…"""
"""At them! At them! No hanging back now!"""
"""I love the smell of victory in the morning. Smells like… corpses!"""
Bravery is all very well, but…
"""Give this fellow the run of the lesser purse, there's a good man!"""
"""Money is of no earthly use if it sits in my purse."""
"""Don't be so stupidly provincial about these things."""
"""Husbands. All nicely broken in and ready for a change, I find..."""
"""Nice armour. It'll look better on my bedroom floor."""
This man has a serpentine mind, unhindered by polite convention.
This man has a sense for danger, warning him when things are wrong.
The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune have entirely missed this man.
That which does not kill you can really make your eyes water.
This man makes excellent choices in bed partners. And then acts on those choices.
This man seems entirely likely to father a new generation. On his own.
This man apparently need only look at a girl for her to fall pregnant!
This woman obeys the gods, first and last.
Spying on spies can be so much fun. Deadly. But fun.
This agent can frustrate any plotting by enemies.
Plots and counterplots intrigue this agent.
Modesty is a becoming trait in beautiful women, and Romans in high office.
"""I am free to be master. You are free to be a slave."""
Experience brings caution this woman's actions.
"""Would I lie to you, friend? Would I?"""
"""I have it on good authority that…"""
Some people lack the traditional number of grandparents.
"""Hurt her with a word, she'll come at you with a knife. She'll smile over your cremated remains…"""
The sea-gods blessed this man with tactical wit.
This man usually wins when defending at sea.
This man understands defence at sea.
This man makes poor choices in his bed partners. That's all it is. Oh, yes.
Children are not a terribly visible product of this man's loins.
This man seems unlikely to fathter a new generation.
"""I like pigs. Do you like pigs? Jupiter's best snack. Ever."""
This man can handle himself in a fight.
Cut to ribbons, this man somehow lived. Poor fellow.
Some scars go deep, all the way to the soul.
Women and children fear to look upon his face.
"""It's a simple matter of making people understand…"""
A way with words is a powerful skill.
To serve the Senate and People is the highest honour.
"""He wanks as high as any in Wome, you know…"""
There is no higher duty than imposing Roman order.
War is a Roman's true vocation.
The maintenance of tradition is an honourable duty.
Looking after Rome's money is a sign of great trust.
This man has the morals of a true Roman.
"""Do you like my collection of ears?"""
"""Start with their toes and work up."""
"""They worship the dead. It's just not right."""
Wits can take a man further than strong legs.
This man works hard in every hour the gods send.
Wealth is power, and this man has power to spare.
Unity among the Romans pleases the gods.
Mercy in a conqueror is always strength.
"""I love the way the Games show off manly... virtues..."""
"""What could be nicer than a well-oiled gladiator? Or two..."""
Love of the Games fills this woman's waking hours. And dreams.
Decorum is less important than a good seat at the races.
"""I may be a lady, but I am an authority on the use of the whip…"""
This woman enjoys the races: the sights, the smells, the excitement!
Straightforward, Roman integrity banishes any hint of corruption.
This man has read up on theories of battlefield command.
After long study of classical battles, this man has a grasp of tactics.
An encyclopaedic knowledge of tactical writings gives this man an edge.
"""As mother said, it pays to look after your health…"""
Even picking up a sword exhausts this poor fellow.
Childhood illness casts its shadow over this man.
Things are what they are. Water is wet. This man is not trustworthy.
This man is as despicably false as any Roman.
Do not trust this man any further than you can throw him.
As a child, this man was adopted as a mascot by his father's troops and keeps their affection.
This man respects the natural order of things, and knows his place precisely.
Many disapprove of this woman's foreign affectations.
This woman delights in un-Roman things. Thank the gods her father cannot see it!
"""An interest in the exotic is one thing, but gods! Dressing in such a fashion..."""
"""Luck is not enough. You must use luck when it comes."""
The rod and axe have their uses.
This woman persuades by her shining example, not words.
"""You dress in the manner of a male prostitute! And not a particularly expensive one!"""
"""I have known pigs with more wit, personality and better table manners…"""
"""All I have heard from you is the sad spraying of fluxed backsides!"""
Battle is an old friend, as welcome as good wine.
A fearless warrior, his men always follow him, no matter the risk.
This man's courage inspires many great feats of arms.
An open, friendly manner puts all who deal with this man at ease.
This woman's body is a temple, inside and out.
Soldiers need steel, not soft words.
An easy nature is welcome until enemy swords are drawn.
Kind words do not win battles.
"""Now, don't listen to me, but I think you should…"""
"""I wouldn't dream of telling you what you want to do…"""
This man is definitely developing his skills as an admiral.
Command at sea has made this man a legend.
This man has a superior grasp of naval tactics.
When close relatives become parents the results can be unfortunate.
The power of life and death can be found in the smallest things.
"""It's amazing what poisons you can find in the undergrowth!"""
Without water people become surprisingly flexible in their outlook.
You can put a dead horse in water but you can't make anyone else drink.
"""Does this water smell a bit… well, you know? Off?"""
This man is blessed with the constitution of a god!
Illness is something that happens to other people.
A strapping fellow, strong as an ox!
"""Bacchus! I like Bacchus! Try the red, dear… Do you like Bacchus?"""
"""This wine makes even you look handsome, handsome…"""
"""There's nothing wrong with a little drinky!"""
"""If you look past all the make-up and paraphernalia, they're really stand-up blokes."""
"""Stick a false beard on a Greek and turn him into Pharaoh? I don't think so!"""
There are wonders in the world for those who think.
"""A lowly born but inherently worthy man may properly rise to eminence in the world."""
"""Smelly, trouser-wearing, excessively-bearded excuses for men. Bastards!"""
"""The gods have written my name in the stars!"""
This person has a real sense of adventure.
This man'th affected lithp ith howwid. And he callth himthelf a Wohman… Weahlly!
This man delights in un-Roman things. Appalling chap.
Many disapprove of this man's foreign tastes.
People don't question an honest face.
"""I change my face the way others change their clothes."""
This person can blend into the dullest carpets.
"""Straight-talking bunch. Lovely women. Even better falooda…"""
An open, friendly manner puts all who deal with this woman at their ease.
Generosity adds to a woman's popularity.
Command at sea has given this man a shiny helmet. But nothing else.
This man's mother is a better admiral.
This man is uncertain of water. And battle.
This woman works hard during every hour the gods grant her.
This man's long-accumulated prestige enables him to influence those around him.
"""I like a titter. But there are limits..."""
Acts of vengeance are understood by the gods.
"""They do exactly what they say they'll do. I respect that. Don't wash much, mind..."""
"""You really shouldn't have killed my uncle."""
"""They keep marrying their own sisters and poisoning each other. Gives me the willies!"""
Power comes naturally to this man, and he enjoys using it.
Persuasion and sincerity are powerful weapons.
This man enjoys politicking, and that makes him good at it.
"""Don't be so provincial about these things."""
"""His wife, the commander's wife, the governor's wife. All nicely broken in, I find..."""
"""Nice dress. It'll look better on my bedroom floor."""
The men hate his guts, but they do what they are told.
"""Drill is worship! Worship of the gods of war!"""
"""I have decided to pick on you. Because I can."""
Childhood illness casts a shadow over this woman.
Picking up a grape exhausts this poor woman.
"""As mother said, it pays to look after your health…"""
Generosity adds to a man's popularity.
"""How do you make a slave go 'woomph'?"""
Burning issues must be acted on.
The only good easterner is a very dead easterner.
When this woman speaks, others listen. Carefully.
Government is a firm, loving father to the people.
"""My hands are tied. Rules are rules."""
"""Poison is so messy. All that puke and shit. Ugh."""
A nice clean insertion, under the ribs, solves many a problem.
"""I prefer surprise in all things, particularly killing."""
"""Tree and stone! I honour the gods, man!"""
"""The gods are here, now, listening, and we do well to remember it."""
"""On your knees and give thanks to the gods!"""
"""I understand the servile mind, and its plotting…"""
Roman law should be unshakeable, inflexible, and painful to miscreants.
Good order is the only duty of anyone in government.
Firm government. Fair government. Roman government.
This woman is quick to anger. And she remembers enemies. Oh, yes, she remembers…
"""They poured molten gold down his throat. I was bricking it, I can tell you."""
"""It was easier than you think. Romans are stupid."""
"""I might melt it down. Ugly thing."""
"""The gods help those who ask least."""
"""Do you know what true love is? Sacrifice."""
"""Maybe the gods don't exist, but if they do I want their help."""
A talent for destruction is worth its weight in gold.
A wanton disregard for the property of others can be useful.
Sabotage is a misunderstood art form.
"""Look! Look! I spent a fortune on it. Her. Them. Aren't they delightful?"""
"""How absolutely fascinating! Wonderful! Such a colourful folk!"""
"""I always enjoy meeting new people. Terribly interesting…"""
"""Stranger. Strange, not usual. You see: the name's a clue."""
"""Funny people. Not funny ha-ha. Funny wrong."""
"""Get them out of my sight! I'll have none of their sort near me!"""
This man threw the book of naval tactics overboard. The fool.
Seagull droppings have more defensive ability.
This man couldn't defend his mother's honour, let alone a fleet.
An all-seeing eye is of use to a wise ruler.
This man has eyes and ears everywhere.
Nothing gives this man more pleasure than the secrets of others.
This man's humanity and forebearance are considered by all to be great virtues.
"""My word is my bond. Backed by my sword."""
"""They're not proper Greeks, and as for being the heirs of Alexander? Oh, sod off!"""
"""A small wager, then, just to make it interesting…"""
"""My luck will change soon. It must!"""
Win, lose, it's all the same to this man.
Even a woman can have a natural air of command.
The plight of others does little to move this person.
Some people are just cold hearted.
"""For the love of the gods! He's already really dead!"""
Some warriors just don't know when to stop.
"""I have decided to pick on you. Because I can."""
"Random ""bar-bar-bar"" gibberings echo through this man's dreams."
Nice Carthaginians are greedy, rapacious, miserly, cheating, baby-murdering scum.
"""I understand the servile mind, and its plotting…"""
"""Fine allies! Have a tendency to turn up with elephants. Which is nice…"""
Big buildings, thrusting upwards, say something about the builder.
"""I will be remembered as a builder, not a slayer!"""
"""My vision will last a thousand years!"""
"""This? It's just a flesh wound! Who's next?!"""
A true heroine never turns away from battle.
To offer ones life for the protection of others is noble indeed.
"""It's a lovely place, and the people are so warm."""
There are mysteries revealed only to adepts.
Laugh, and the world cringes in terror.
"""I am mad. You are mad. We are mad. And so is Lord Mushroom. Deal with it."""
"""I like your eyes. You have nice eyes. Very nice eyes. Yes."""

Spying on spies can be so much fun. Deadly. But fun.
This agent can frustrate any plotting by enemies.
This man's timidity in combat is well known, the big wendy.
Fear hinders this man in battle. Fear of battle.
This man runs from a battle before it is strictly necessary. Or lost.
"""You've never heard of that? Oh, how funny!"""
"""it is important to practice every day."""
A good grasp of local culture can be useful.
When you kill a man, he always gets the message.
Murder doesn't have to look like murder.
"""Murder? No, no, no. He fell. Accidentally. Onto 17 daggers."""
There is absolutely nothing wrong with money when it serves Rome.
Words have weight when spoken by this man.
People listen, believe and act when this man speaks.
"""One day, all men will be free…"""
"""What justice do you expect from your masters?"""
"""You will all die in bondage unless you kill your masters first!"""
"""I might know people who might know someone to do that kind of thing…"""
This man can convince many with the force of his arguments.
"""I am free to be mistress. You are free to be a slave."""
Modesty is a becoming trait, particularly in women.
This primus palus earned his freedom over many long years in the ludus.
That which does not kill you can really make your eyes water.
Death has entirely failed to take this woman unawares.
This woman senses danger, a warning when things are awry.
"""Look, we make the pie bigger, then everyone can have some… No. It's not a real pie."""
Smiling, even at another's misfortunes, does not come naturally to this old sour-face.
Wits can take a woman further than shapely legs.
"""No. You don't get to live through this."""
Love of the Games makes this man popular with the plebs.
Womenfolk are of less interest than a well-oiled gladiator…

This man enjoys the races, making him popular.
An authority on horseflesh, and the use of the whip…
Duty is less important than a good seat at the races.

Murder doesn't have to look like murder.

A little wine never hurt anyone.
Drink steadies the hand. Yes. It does.
"""They put the child into Tanit's arms. He rolled into the fire. And they just let it happen!"""
"""Your case is denied. Leave your bribe as you go."""
"""YOU! Execute them faster! Stop being nice about it!"""
"""I have considered this petition. Ask again, and you will need a will."""
People listen, believe and act when this woman speaks.
Words have weight when spoken by this woman.
This woman speaks well, appealing to heart and head.
This man's brutal axe-rage is something to behold.
This woman has been blessed with good health by the gods!
This man: if you see him coming, run. Just run. Fast!
Illness is something that happens to other people.
This is a radiant, healthy and vital woman.
"""Grrrrrrrr! The red mist comes! Let me at 'em!"""
This woman can convince many her wit and arguments.
This woman can move hearts and minds with words alone.
This woman can hold an audience spellbound, caught in a dazzling web of words.
"""I am told that even the poor find shit offensive, don't you know…"""
This man has defeated enemies of Rome.
"""Look behind you, remember you are only a man."""
Having conquered an entire people, this man has earned Roman admiration.
"""I have enemies. More than you can count. And that's just inside these walls!"""
"""There! Behind the tapestry! And there! Everywhere!"""
"""I'm followed. Everywhere. And not by servants."""
This woman's reputation and influence are well deserved.
Robbing the vanquished is not enough for this man.
What's a little genocide between friends?
Good fortune has a way of marking some men.
An honest face is matched by an honest manner.
This man's name is a byword for honesty and integrity.
Straightforward dealing has given this man an enviable reputation.
Money does not grow on trees, or swim the seas!
"""I take no joy from spending money. It is always a waste of coin!"""
"""Why should I open my purse? What purpose does it serve?"""
The Fates have granted this woman a destiny. All know it.
"""Call me what you like. I will enjoy the riches of my mines."""
There is much wealth to be found beneath the earth.
Mother Earth gives up her wealth to those wise enough to find it.
Friends who regularly exchange gifts are good friends indeed.
"""If it can't be bought with gold it's not worth having."""
This woman has a serpentine mind masked by polite convention.
"""Had her. Had her. Had her. Twice. And her mum…"""
"""Well, hello. Ding. Dong. Aren't you the lucky girl?"""
"""Go on, go on, go on, go on. You will. You will, you will, you will."""
Loss of status and prestige has made this man bitter, envious and discontented.
This man understands basic strategy, and knows he must study more.
This man is an expert on strategy and the history of warfare.
This man's grasp of military matters is the envy of all.
"""I don't need to get pissed before a fight."""
"""Tomorrow you will be a bleary-eyed, vomiting, fart-breathed pig. And I won't."""
Wine, mead or ale: this man will have none of them.
"""The temple? Why would I want to go there?"""
"""Do I look stupid enough to believe in big, bearded, angry men in the sky?"""
"""Every time I offer sacrifice, I wonder why I bother…"""
Some people are just born lucky.
"""Some would call it luck, I call it skill."""
A firm hand on the tiller of the ship of state.
"""I'll swear as much as I want, you utter front bottom!"""
"""I say there IS a god of swearing, you great, puke-stained shit-elf!"""
"""Everything I possess I made, or took, with these two hands…"""
"""Arise, brothers and sisters! Together we will build a new future!"""
"""It doesn't have to be this way, my brothers and sisters!"""
"""The gods gave me this face as a sign of favour."""
"""I fight where the enemy are not."""
"""I do not fight my enemy's strength, only his weakness."""
Darkness hides an army of knives.
"""It's amazing what poisons you can find in the undergrowth!"""
The power of life and death can be found in the smallest things.
This man persuades by example, not words.
Strong oaths make this man a 'character'. And rude.
This man cannot speak without using the foulest curses.
Appalling foulness constantly drips from this man's tongue.
Kindness is not weakness. Kindness is strength.
Any fool can make misery. I choose to be better than a fool.
I choose to be good to my people. It encourages loyalty.
"""Well, hello. Aren't I the lucky girl? Bring your friend..."""
"""Go on, go on, go on, go on. You will. You will, you will, you will."""
"""Him: not bad. Him: ugh, smelly. Him: twice. His dad was fun…"""
"""Under my roof we are not lewd, lascivious drunkards swimming in our own vomit!"""
Sober consideration of everything is this man's way in life.
Wine may be nice, but this man would never know it.
Endless revelations of perversity, real and imagined, eventually grow boring.
Even the gods of lust and love would turn their backs on this man.
Even the briefest encounter with this vile pervert sees most folk running to the bathhouse to scrape themselves clean.
Why do today what can be put off until next week?
"""Why should I? Those slaves are standing idle."""
If he could find someone else to move his bowels for him, he would.
"""Any woman who says she doesn't… well, leaves more for me!"""
"""The particularly rude statues? Particularly? How charming!"""
On campaign with his father this man grew up around soldiers and knows their ways.
"""Doubt is the enemy of any marksman."""
"""The particularly rude statues are actually modelled on me…"""
"""Who doesn't? Those funny Greeks, maybe. How very... civilized of them."""
"""I can shoot a tick off the hind leg of a rat!"""
Always the first to point an accusing finger…
Daring in recovering an eagle has somewhat restored this man's honour.
"""I do only what any good Roman would."""
A vicious tongue has a point.
"""Gods shit on us all! Am I talking to a walking scrotum?"""
"""Look at the state of you, General Tiny Bollocks..."""
This man cannot be trusted any further than he can be thrown. With an onager.
Count your fingers after shaking hands...
This man is so despicable he might well be from Carthage.
This man enjoys the sight of blood, particularly enemy blood.
This man delights in bloodshed for its own sake.
A good ear for languages is a blessing, as is a winning manner.
Swords and boots are useful, but orders move armies.
"""The gods gave me this face and the rest as a sign of favour."""
"""Leave it with me… You'll get your swords."""
Armies march on their bellies, but they run on paperwork.
"""There is a god of swearing. Yes, there f****** is!"""
His foul and inventive tongue endears this man only to his troops.
After long years campaigning, this man speaks like the soldiery.
A goatherd may rise to greatness if it is written.
The greatest of commanders serves the gods, the state and the people.
Leadership in the name of the state is an honour.
Law is the master of all.
To speak honestly, for the good of all, is a high duty.
To look after the state's treasure is a mark of trust and respect.
There is honour and virtue in equal measure in serving the gods.
Duty to the state honours the bearer of that duty.
There are pleasures of the flesh that only some enjoy.
"""The 'who' or 'what' doesn't matter. The 'how' usually does."""
It is not spying. It's a quest for knowledge.
The enemy have few secrets from this woman.
Sifting truth from falsehood is a woman's skill.
This man's every night is torn apart by the Furies, egged on by shrieking Greeks…
This Roman is properly frugal in all things, but never mean.
An unconcerned expression hides many thoughts.
"""Rise brothers! Together we will build a new future!"""
"""It doesn't have to be this way, my brothers!"""
"""I see you looking. And yes, I work out."""
Bravery on the battlefield is worthy.
Foes sent astray are foes defeated.
An army in the wrong place is useless.
Acts of vengeance are properly Roman.
"""Bow before me, puny men of Earth, or suffer the attentions of my cloth-rending moths!"""
Chewing one's own nails is bad, but the nails of others…
"""Don't lie to me. My eyes WILL fall out if I stop looking up."""
Father. Family. Rome. Three words define a life.
This woman is a model of Roman superiority and morality.
Love for Rome is matched only by an understandable distrust of foreigners.
Self-control grants control of many things.
Laugh, and the world laughs as you spill your drink.

"""Drink! Drink! Why aren't you drinking, you bastards?"""
Losing one eagle is bad luck, losing another is just plain carelessness.
Romans, with their straight roads, aqueducts, law-making ways, and big bent noses, really annoy this man.
Having lost the eagle of his legion, this man is a disgrace.
This woman respects the natural order of things, and knows her place precisely.

This man has a talent for persuasion and sensible compromise.
This man has always understood tact and the diplomatic niceties.
All the good is gone, leaving nothing but betrayal.
Those who deal in lies should never be trusted.
Some people would sell their own mother in the name of advancement.

The people will be given a voice.
Words are more effective than stones.

"The word ""Roman"" alone brings this man out in a cold sweat."
"""I look for advantage. What man does not?"""
Right and wrong: two sides of the same, golden, spendable coin.
"""The gold was just resting in my purse."""

"""Sod off! Find your own bucket of ale!"""
"""Are you looking at my drink, you bastard? Did you spill my girl?"""

The conquered have a right to be ruled.
It is no trifling thing to be a friend to the King.
Keeping a bloodline pure is not always a good idea.
Command is an honour for those who exercise it.
Good administration is like fresh air. It's absence is quickly noticed.
Honesty should be enforced in all things, even market haggling.
This man is so effective that people wonder what he does all day.
It is an honour to honour the gods.

There are wonders in the world for those who look.
To offer ones life for the protection of others is noble indeed.
A true hero never turns from battle.

Love for Rome is matched only by an understandable distrust of foreigners.
This man is the model of Roman rectitude and superiority. Mostly superiority.
This man obviously relishes shedding blood.

His thirst for battle is insatiable, no matter the cost in lives.

Beyond brave, this man inspires courage in his followers.
In battle this man inspires warriors to acts of insane heroism.
A formidable war leader, respected even by his enemies.

"""Don't eat the biscuits. I think they're off."""

"""I find people are very helpful when there's a knife at their throats…"""

"""At some point the enemy will have to send orders."""
"""I just know where the enemy is."""

"""And what if I am well-connected by blood and marriage?"""
"""I don't need to get pissed before a fight."""

To serve the king is an honour for the worthy.
To command cavalry is a sacred trust.
To serve the king is a great honour for the particularly noteworthy.
To guard the king is honour enough for any man.
The royal presence must be properly guarded and honoured.
Mastery of soldiers is a solemn duty to the state.
Command of those close to the king is a mighty honour.
The voice of command must only be raised in defence of the state.
Guarding the foundations of the state is an important duty.
He who holds a fort is a trusted man.
There is honour in service, honourably rendered.
He who looks to the army's needs is an honourable man.
Mastering the worth of the state is a vital duty.
To command soldiers is an honour and a trust.
A man that men will follow into the wolf's jaws is indeed worthy.
An old sword often has a cunning edge.
When some speak, their word is law.
All-high father, guide and provider to the people.
A man's acts, more than his parentage, mark out his worth.
The burden of leadership is also an honour to the leader.
A man's words in war give iron to his words in peace.

This man knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
"""Come on! Haggle! It's not worth that!"""

This pious man is seen to be obeying the gods in all things.

"""Count the silverware if you invite her to dinner…"""

People get scared in the dark. Not this man.

This man is almost unsurpassed when attacking.

"""Under this roof we are not lewd, lascivious drunkards swimming in our own vomit!"""

Sober consideration of everything is this woman's way in life.
Darkness is not a friend. Never that.
Wine may be nice, but this woman would never know it.
This man is terrified by the long, long hours of night.
"This man might as well put up a sign saying ""ambush ahead""."
This man couldn't organise a piss-up in the temple of Bacchus, let alone a surprise attack.
Despite his best efforts, this man's ambushes never work as planned.
"""The gold was just resting in my purse."""
Right and wrong: two sides of the same, golden, spendable coin.
"""I look for advantage. What woman does not?"""
Cold and uncharismatic, this woman is difficult to like.
Honesty should be enforced in all things, even market haggling.
The law separates men from beasts.
It is an honour to honour the gods.
The conquered have a right to be ruled.
To serve the people and state is a high calling.
Command is an honour for those who exercise it.
Bringing justice to the ruled is an honourable calling.
Some men have a natural air of command.
"""A fair shake all round, that's what I say. Unusual, isn't it?"""
The first and last thing ambushed targets know is that they are dead!
The noble art of surprise is personified in this man.
This man's ambushes are hard and fast, and leave few alive to tell the tale.
Fate has fired many arrows at this man, and he had dodged them all.
A man does not become more attractive as the amphora is drained.
Drinking lying down saves a lot of tedious falling over.
"""Why aren't you drinking? Weaklings! Utter men, the lot of you!"""
Use the clamps. The tiny clamps. The ones with teeth.
Your pain, your despair... are like honeyed wine to me.
This man's defensive experience gives his men confidence.
This man's superior defensive skill often gets the better of attackers.
In defence this man has a clear head and a strong hand.
The kings of old are reborn again in this man.
Defence is not part of this man's art of war.
This man has no discernable talent for defence.
This man lacks confidence when defending.
"""I don't take no for an answer."""
"""Twenty-six dwarves sent to Charon. So I know one end of a sword from the other."""
This man can defend a settlement. Alone, if needs must.
Give this man a wall and he'll hold it against the gods!
This man's defensive skills are worthy of an epic poem.
"""It is not spying. It's a quest for knowledge."""
The enemy have few secrets from this man.
Sifting truth from falsehood: the skill of the master.
"""Lord Amphora is my friend. My only friend. Not like you…"""
"""God told me. That slave had elves inside her. I didn't find them."""
"""I like pans. Why don't you like pans?"""
This man's siege skills are nigh on legendary.
Remarkable skills when assaulting walls make this man an expert.
This man has an eye for weakness and a talent for exploiting it.
A full belly does not like a sword belt round it.
Well-managed land is the basis of wealth.
Land left unused might as well be beneath the sea.
This man is easy to annoy, anger and enrage. And he remembers his enemies. Oh, yes…
Age grants wisdom in all things.
Honesty should be enforced in all things, even market haggling.
The law separates men from beasts.
It is an honour to honour the gods.
The conquered have a right to be ruled.
There is more wisdom in five hearts than in one.
Command is an honour for those who exercise it.
The conquered must be made to serve.
"""You going to die. And I'm not sorry. No, not one bit."""
Every blade of grass out of place tells a story.
Enemies cannot hide from a piercing gaze.
"""Many men. Travelling fast. Three were limping…"""
This woman is properly frugal in all things, but never mean.
This man is the embodiment of all that is good and true in Romans.
This man lacks confidence when attacking.
This man has problems organising an attack.
This man can turn victory into humiliating defeat!
Reputation and influence are entirely worthy in this man's case.
To carry a sword in defence of the people is an honour.
A man who defends his people defends his honour.
A true warrior answers to nothing except his own stout heart.
A friend of heroes is a hero himself.
Age brings wisdom and need not weaken a strong sword arm.
Mastery carries the responsibility to do the right thing.
The highest of the high bears the heaviest burdens.
"""People get so… possessive about coins. They have my face on them, after all."""
"""I like taxes. I like people who pay taxes. Promptly."""
A good ruler always has expenses. That is why there are taxes.
A raise of an eyebrow is enough to turn men's bowels to water.
"""Don't be afraid, I won't hurt you, much."""
Sometimes a reputation for violence is enough.
"""Sod off! Find your own bucket of ale!"""
"""Leave 'im, Arminius. He's not wurf it! I'll do 'im! I will..."""
The people will be given a voice.
"""A riot? You call this a riot? I'll show you a riot!"""
Words are more effective than stones.
